Oh, hold on, when you say lc player, do you mean VLC player? coz I use the latest version of that already. I think that .mkv is a wrapper and can contain different types of video and I have some 90mb .mkv files that play fine in VLC but I think that a lot of them such as this 598.05mb file requires that your video card has some hardware acceleration and this is where I'm getting stuck with my cheapo dual-head card. I can play most any video file but not h264 or some .mkv (any scOrp file) ... oh well :-(

and guys i dont know wat processer u need but vlc plays all mkv even  in age old systems.. if it doesnt ur system is useless. simple

I can appreciate the love of the smaller file sizes but you need to know that if you do that then you are limiting your audience. Hundreds of .avi files will play on my PC and my windows mobile phone but as soon as I try H264 or scOrp's lovely smaller files they are unwatchable on my windows 7 system (freezing, juddering etc.) and the phone can't play them either. Unfortunately I'm not going to buy a new PC or a new phone just to be able to play H264 or .mkv files :-) This Largo Winch file is just over 600mb on disk, a .avi file will be 700mb so you save 100mb but your file can't be viewed by everyone... swings and roundabouts.
